snippet: Arizona, Colorado, South Dakota and Utah expressed interest in a proposal by the interior secretary that could open some national parks closed by the government shutdown.
abstract: Governors of Arizona, Colorado, South Dakota and Utah express interest in proposal by Interior Secretary Sally Jewell to allow them to reopen national parks in their states closed by federal government shutdown, though it remains unclear whether any such deals could be reached soon; agreements would hinge on states paying full operating costs.

byline.contributor: Jack Healy and Ian Lovett contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Arizona, Colorado, South Dakota and Utah expressed interest in a proposal by the interior secretary that could open some national parks closed by the government shutdown.

headline.main: U.S. Offer Would Let Some States Open Parks
headline.print_headline: U.S. Offer Would Let Some States Open Parks
